column1: Most Americans followed the Haiti earthquake aftermath closely.
column2: Most Americans followed the Indian Ocean tsunami aftermath closely.
column3: Most Americans followed the Japan tsunami aftermath closely.
column4: About 1/3 of Americans followed the Philippines typhoon aftermath closely.
column5: About 1/3 of Americans followed the China earthquake aftermath closely.
column6: Fewer than 1/3 of Americans followed the Chile earthquake aftermath closely.
column7: About a quarter of Americans followed the Burma cyclone aftermath closely.
column8: About a quarter of Americans followed the Pakistan earthquake aftermath closely.
column9: The Haiti earthquake was the most followed international natural distaster story by Americans in the last 8 years.
column10: Fewer Americans are following the Philippines earthquake aftermath closely than followed some other recent major disasters.
